bib.title: Thermal neutron capture cross sections of the potassium isotopes

free_txt: Guided neutron beam at 10-MW Budapest
Reactor.
VS
VS.  3HUNII -> 3HUNKFI
n-type high-purity, 25% efficient, germanium
HPGe detector. The detector is Compton-suppressed
by a Bismuth Germanate (BGO)-scintillator guard
detector annulus surrounded by 10-cm-thick lead
shielding. The detector is located at 23.5 cm from
the target.
Details not given.
Guided neutron beam at 10-MW Budapest
Reactor.
The thermal-equivalent neutron flux was 2x10**6 n/cm2/s
Data for potassium
isotopic abundances
Monitor cross section for the 786.3 + 788.4 keV
doublet.
Weighted average. The uncertainties has been
increased to that of the most precise measurement.
Standardized to the
cross section at 1951.1 keV from
Z.Revay et al. Radiochimica Acta 91, 361 (2003) using
gamma-ray emission probabilities of Molnar et al. Nucl.
Instrum.  Meth. Phys. Res. B 213,32 (2005).
0.02 g stoichiometric high purity KCl elemental target.
Data from Table I. of PR/C,87,024605,2013
The 770.3-keV gamma-ray cross section was used for
internal calibration.
0.75 g KHCO3 powder, suspended in a teflon  bag
to reduce the background from the target holder.
Data from Table II. of PR/C,87,024605,2013
The 770.3-keV gamma-ray cross section was used for
internal calibration.
Data for the gamma-rays intensities and level
assignments.
An 0.75 g KHCO3 powder, suspended in a teflon  bag
to reduce the background from the target holder.
The 770.3-keV gamma-ray cross section was used for

statistical gamma-ray feeding.
